review_blob: This is my first rating, so forgive the amateur quality. I started with this one because I like the idea: Get major beer makers to create their "desert island beer" and see what happens. This one fits the bill for me. Theres a lightness to it, and a low 4.5 ABV that would encourage frequent hydration. Its got a nice fluffy head (large bubbles, not creamy) about a pinky thick. Pale cloudy yellow with a steady stream of tiny bubbles rising. I only know the concept "Simcoe" hops from the bottle, but I do like the "California IPA" style, and this echoes that, to me. Theres a floral funkiness that I love, and a medium bitterness. Looking forward to other "Table Beer" entries.
